title: Winnie Harlow's Engagement Nails Match the Vibe of Her Stunning Ring
description: Winnie Harlow has cemented herself as one of today's most sought-after talents in beauty. She even founded the successful skin-care brand Cay Skin, proving she's more than just "the girl from America's Next Top Model." The latest title to be added to Harlow's résumé? Fiancée. On Feb. 13, the 30-year-old got engaged to NBA basketball star Kyle Kuzma during a romantic getaway in Turks & Caicos - complete with a jaw-dropping, 8.5-carat oval-cut engagement ring (with two baguette stones on the side). And of course, our eyes are on her nails. View this post on Instagram A post shared by ♔Winnie Harlow♔ (@winnieharlow) Harlow's nails - painted a gorgeous nude shade with soft creamy pink tones - matched the vibe of her classic ring perfectly. The manicure is a nod to the "rich girl" manicure trend that took over our social media feeds last summer. Originally coined by celebrity manicurist Tom Bachik, "rich girl" nails are "a modern take on a sophisticated classic," as he puts it. Spotted on other stars like Jennifer Lopez, Ciara, and Bella Hadid, the trend is usually marked by a full-coverage set with greige (beige and gray) tones that are either one shade lighter or darker than a person's natural skin tone, creating a subtle, yet statement-making manicure. Harlow's nails are on the pinker side, but they feature greige undertones, proving the trend is here to stay. In case you've been looking for a minimal nail shade that feels luxurious or you want to stay prepared for your own engagement (you never know when it'll happen), consider picks like the Essie Salon-Quality Nail Polish in Wild Nude ($9, originally $10) or the Chanel Le Vernis Longwear Nail Colour in Faussaire ($33) to help you nail the trend. Naomi Parris is a New York-based fashion and beauty writer with over seven years of experience. She served as an editorial operations associate at PS, specializing in all things fashion. Her work has also been seen in Elle, Essence Girls United, Bustle, and Elite Daily. Obsessed with telling stories that merge fashion and culture, her areas of expertise include Fashion Week coverage, high-profile interviews, shopping roundups, op-eds, and beauty stories.
author: Naomi Parris
excerpt: Model Winnie Harlow and N.B.A. player Kyle Kuzma got engaged, and we're obsessed with her "rich girl" ombre nails.

html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Winnie Harlow has cemented herself as one of today's most sought-after talents in beauty. She even founded the successful skin-care brand Cay Skin, proving she's more than just "the girl from America's Next Top Model." The latest title to be added to Harlow's résumé? Fiancée. On Feb. 13, the 30-year-old got engaged to NBA basketball star Kyle Kuzma during a romantic getaway in Turks & Caicos — complete with a jaw-dropping, 8.5-carat oval-cut engagement ring (with two baguette stones on the side). And of course, our eyes are on her nails.

Harlow's nails — painted a gorgeous nude shade with soft creamy pink tones — matched the vibe of her classic ring perfectly. The manicure is a nod to the "rich girl" manicure trend that took over our social media feeds last summer. Originally coined by celebrity manicurist Tom Bachik, "rich girl" nails are "a modern take on a sophisticated classic," as he puts it. Spotted on other stars like Jennifer Lopez, Ciara, and Bella Hadid, the trend is usually marked by a full-coverage set with greige (beige and gray) tones that are either one shade lighter or darker than a person's natural skin tone, creating a subtle yet statement-making manicure. Harlow's nails are on the pinker side, but they feature greige undertones, proving the trend is here to stay.

In case you've been looking for a minimal nail shade that feels luxurious or you want to stay prepared for your own engagement (you never know when it'll happen), consider picks like the Essie Salon-Quality Nail Polish in Wild Nude ($9, originally $10) or the Chanel Le Vernis Longwear Nail Colour in Faussaire ($33) to help you nail the trend.

Naomi Parris is a New York-based fashion and beauty writer with over seven years of experience. She served as an editorial operations associate at PS, specializing in all things fashion. Her work has also been seen in Elle, Essence Girls United, Bustle, and Elite Daily. Obsessed with telling stories that merge fashion and culture, her areas of expertise include Fashion Week coverage, high-profile interviews, shopping roundups, op-eds, and beauty stories.
